params.name: name
params.description: The image on which this operation is performed.

params.name: width
params.description: New width of the image. If this value is blank, the width is calculated proportionately to the height.

params.name: height
params.description: New height of the image. If this value is blank, the height is calculated proportionately to the width.

params.name: interpolation
params.description: The interpolation method for resampling. You can specify a specific interpolation algorithm by name (for example, hamming), by image quality (for example, mediumQuality), or by performance (for example, highestPerformance).

params.name: blurfactor
params.description: The blur factor used for resampling. The higher the blur factor, the more blurred the image (also, the longer it takes to resize the image).

examples.title: Tag Syntax
examples.description: This example shows how to resize an image to 50% of original size and resize it proportionately to the new width. Notice that the height is blank.
